pr_title: jsp23_fat trace update to help diagnose injection/interceptor issue

timeline.bodyText: Why are we adding CDI traces to a server that does not enable CDI?
timeline.author: pnicolucci
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@
         <feature>jsp-2.3</feature>
     </featureManager>
     
-    <logging traceSpecification="*=info=enabled:com.ibm.ws.webcontainer*=all:com.ibm.wsspi.webcontainer*=all:HTTPChannel=all:TCPChannel=all:GenericBNF=all:com.ibm.ws.jsp*=all" maxFileSize="32" maxFiles="24" traceFormat="BASIC"/> 
+    <logging traceSpecification="*=info=enabled:JCDI=all:com.ibm.ws.webbeans*=all:org.apache.webbeans*=all:org.jboss.weld*=all:com.ibm.ws.cdi*=all:com.ibm.ws.wswebcontainer*=all:com.ibm.ws.webcontainer*=all:com.ibm.wsspi.webcontainer*=all:HTTPChannel=all:TCPChannel=all:GenericBNF=all:com.ibm.ws.jsp*=all" maxFileSize="32" maxFiles="24" traceFormat="BASIC"/>

replies.bodyText: I don't think we use com.ibm.ws.wswebcontainer any more
replies.author: pmd1nh

replies.bodyText: trace is now only added to jspCdiServer
replies.author: epj
